channel.title: Comments on: Dyno Tune with Steve Kan

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://grandmighty.github.io/grandmighty/2013/03/dyno-tune-with-steve-kan/#comment-56193">Kent</a>.
Thanks Kent, I was actually just doing research on future tunes down in SoCal. A tune is like a maintenance item, gotta keep it updated ;-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Kent.

Thanks Kent, I was actually just doing research on future tunes down in SoCal. A tune is like a maintenance item, gotta keep it updated ;-)

item.title: By: Kent
item.dc:creator: Kent
item.description: Awesome, glad it worked out. Sorry if I was a factor as to why you settled with Steve Kan instead. But what's done is done and it definitely came out pretty well. Good call on that "reverse boost creep" too.
item.content:encoded: Awesome, glad it worked out. Sorry if I was a factor as to why you settled with Steve Kan instead. But what’s done is done and it definitely came out pretty well. Good call on that “reverse boost creep” too.

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://grandmighty.github.io/grandmighty/2013/03/dyno-tune-with-steve-kan/#comment-56079">Jackson Tran</a>.
For sure, say hello if we ever cross paths! I was talking to a couple other FD guys today and we're thinking about doing a little BBQ soon, you should keep an eye out for that ;-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jackson Tran.

For sure, say hello if we ever cross paths! I was talking to a couple other FD guys today and we’re thinking about doing a little BBQ soon, you should keep an eye out for that ;-)

item.title: By: Jackson Tran
item.dc:creator: Jackson Tran
item.description: Quite stock and low mileage still! I like having it stock besides that diffuser and downpipe... I never liked throwing in parts without having a good reason to do so. I like your rants! I agree with a lot of your justifications and ideals as to why/why you don't do certain things. Maybe one day I'll run into you in real life, we don't live too far apart!
item.content:encoded: Quite stock and low mileage still! I like having it stock besides that diffuser and downpipe… I never liked throwing in parts without having a good reason to do so. I like your rants! I agree with a lot of your justifications and ideals as to why/why you don’t do certain things. Maybe one day I’ll run into you in real life, we don’t live too far apart!

item.content:encoded:

item.title: By: Jackson Tran
item.dc:creator: Jackson Tran
item.description: Hey my friend David works at Tech3! Keep up the posts eric, i love reading it
item.content:encoded: Hey my friend David works at Tech3! Keep up the posts eric, i love reading it
